Description: Rectangular section of a bead-net: comprising short cylinder beads of red, yellow, blue and white glazed composition, some strung in pairs, and blue glazed composition standard cylinder beads, some of which are faded, strung in a diagonal pattern. One end embellished with seven tassels, each comprising white short cylinder, blue-green standard cylinder and red or blue globular beads of glazed composition with frayed fibre tassels. The net also incorporates a blue winged scarab and four pale blue funerary amulets also of glazed composition.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, p. 102, pl. on p. 102.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.102)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
